title: Behavior of torch.mean (and std) compared to numpy mean (std)
body_html:
Hi,

It's not a real issue, but i was surprised that 'mean' in torch doesn't behave the same way as numpy mean (and numpy std too)

>>> a = np.random.rand(4,4,2)
>>> a.mean((0,1))
array([ 0.41329336,  0.68183061])
>>> b = torch.Tensor(a)
>>> b.mean((0,2))
TypeError: mean received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple), but expected one of:
 * no arguments
 * (int dim)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple)

Looking at the docs, it's expected that i get this error, but it would be very nice to have the same behavior

Thank you
